result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin K Lonergan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $150 fine plus court costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
------------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
------------------------------------

Commencing on or before 5-13-2022 @ 8:00 am With Huber.  IT IS HEREBY Ordered that the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward all restitution and outstanding fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence. 

Electronic monitoring is allowed if the Defendant is found eligible. 

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court. 
------------------------------------

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kevin K Lonergan appeared in court, Attorney Kathryn E. Keizer for Kevin K Lonergan appeared in court. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1, Upon motion of the State count 2 is granted to be dismissed and read in. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Defendant does not make statement. Court gives warning to deportation. Minutes filed.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kevin K Lonergan appeared in Court. James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney options form given; defendant referred to SPD. State needs more time to make charging decision. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
